channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Do people still quote movies?
item.description: NPR's Barrie Hardymon and Marc Rivers discuss why some movie lines become iconic and whether today's films are still creating quotes that last.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Barrie Hardymon and Marc Rivers discuss why some movie lines become iconic and whether today's films are still creating quotes that last.
item.dc:creator: Marc Rivers

item.title: A new U.N. report shows gang control expanding across Haiti
item.description: The Miami Herald's Jacqueline Charles talks about a new U.N. report that highlights how gang violence in Haiti is spreading beyond the capital, and what that means for a country without a functioning government or elections.
item.content:encoded: The Miami Herald's Jacqueline Charles talks about a new U.N. report that highlights how gang violence in Haiti is spreading beyond the capital, and what that means for a country without a functioning government or elections.
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Pierre

item.title: Tornado survivors in St. Louis say recovery is a mess, due to FEMA changes
item.description: Six months after the St. Louis tornado, residents say Trump's new disaster policy has left them on their own.
item.content:encoded: Six months after the St. Louis tornado, residents say Trump's new disaster policy has left them on their own.
item.dc:creator: Sacha Pfeiffer

item.title: A year from now, hemp shops could disappear under a new federal ban
item.description: WFAE's Steve Harrison reports on how the new spending bill imposes new restrictions on hemp and CBD producers nationwide now that the government has re-opened.
item.content:encoded: WFAE's Steve Harrison reports on how the new spending bill imposes new restrictions on hemp and CBD producers nationwide now that the government has re-opened.
item.dc:creator: STEVE HARRISON

item.title: The man who tried to make Texas a country again
item.description: In the 1990s, an armed group pushed for Texas to break from the unio. Zoe Kurland from Marfa Public Radio covers the story in 'A Whole Other Country.'
item.content:encoded: In the 1990s, an armed group pushed for Texas to break from the unio. Zoe Kurland from Marfa Public Radio covers the story in 'A Whole Other Country.'
item.dc:creator: Mallory Yu

item.title: In 'All Her Fault,' Sarah Snook carries the family, and the blame
item.description: Actress Sarah Snook talks about her new Peacock thriller, where a mother's everyday routines spiral into a life-or-death mystery.
item.content:encoded: Actress Sarah Snook talks about her new Peacock thriller, where a mother's everyday routines spiral into a life-or-death mystery.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Handel

item.title: China's astronauts land safely after space debris collision
item.description: Three Chinese astronauts are back on earth after they had to prolong their stay in outer space due to space debris hitting their spacecraft.
item.content:encoded: Three Chinese astronauts are back on earth after they had to prolong their stay in outer space due to space debris hitting their spacecraft.
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: White House pivots to affordability as President Trump confronts voter discontent
item.description: President Trump says he's going to make America affordable again. It's a pivot to focusing on the economy as voters express discontent.
item.content:encoded: President Trump says he's going to make America affordable again. It's a pivot to focusing on the economy as voters express discontent.
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: Redistricting in Missouri revives a century-old racial fault line
item.description: A new Trump-backed voting map reopens Kansas City's racial divide along Troost Avenue.
item.content:encoded: A new Trump-backed voting map reopens Kansas City's racial divide along Troost Avenue.
item.dc:creator: Celisa Calacal

item.title: Mexico's new generation takes to the streets, accusing leaders of protecting cartels
item.description: Gen Z activists are marching in Mexico City today against what they call a narco-state, while Mexican President Sheinbaum alleges the protesters are backed by right-wing parties.
item.content:encoded: Gen Z activists are marching in Mexico City today against what they call a narco-state, while Mexican President Sheinbaum alleges the protesters are backed by right-wing parties.
item.dc:creator: Eyder Peralta
